revised_title: Cobalt's Tractive Force and Magnetizing Properties
tldr: The author compares the tractive force of cobalt and iron with 5 amperes of current and finds that cobalt's force is still very high, being 12,000 times its own weight. The author also experiments with annealed charcoal iron and concludes that the limit of magnetisability is virtually reached when the tractive force remains the same even with a reduced current. This research contributes to the understanding of magnetical science.
